item.title:
The spiral of Theodorus is a spiral composed of right triangles, placed edge-to-edge.
The nᵗʰ triangle in the sequence is a right triangle with side lengths √n and 1, and with hypotenuse √(n + 1)
[read more: https://t.co/buuUAtdAZb] https://t.co/D1iGroXJJ2

item.title:
In several areas of the world, young girls still have to walk miles in the blazing heat everyday to collect water. The Water Wheel carries 5 times more water than a standard pail, requiring only one person per day to go to the well
https://t.co/9J8Zefyku6 https://t.co/qv4UnEjNMv

item.title:
Isaac Newton regarded all varying quantities as flowing quantities. He called fluxion the rate of flowing - he used the dotted notation to refer to it.
Adopting his fluxional notation we can write mechanical equations considering x as a flowing quantity! https://t.co/Ol7MCjiOI2

item.title:
How can AI work better with human experts in areas like medicine where safety is paramount? 🩺
With @GoogleAI, we propose CoDoC: a model that learns when predictive AI is offering correct information - and when it's better to defer to a clinician. https://t.co/gZtLxBVRSr https://t.co/8Y07THi9TX
item.description:
How can AI work better with human experts in areas like medicine where safety is paramount? 🩺
With @GoogleAI, we propose CoDoC: a model that learns when predictive AI is offering correct information - and when it's better to defer to a clinician. https://t.co/gZtLxBVRSr https://t.co/8Y07THi9TX
item.content:encoded: How can AI work better with human experts in areas like medicine where safety is paramount? 🩺 With @GoogleAI, we propose CoDoC: a model that learns when predictive AI is offering correct information - and when it's better to defer to a clinician. https://t.co/gZtLxBVRSr https://t.co/8Y07THi9TX

item.title:
When developing CoDoC, we had 3 criteria:
⚪ Non-AI experts including clinicians could use the system on a single computer ⚪ Training would require a relatively small amount of data ⚪ CoDoC could be compatible with many proprietary AI models
https://t.co/zIG0B6LvvB
item.description:
When developing CoDoC, we had 3 criteria:
⚪ Non-AI experts including clinicians could use the system on a single computer ⚪ Training would require a relatively small amount of data ⚪ CoDoC could be compatible with many proprietary AI models
https://t.co/zIG0B6LvvB
item.content:encoded: When developing CoDoC, we had 3 criteria: ⚪ Non-AI experts including clinicians could use the system on a single computer ⚪ Training would require a relatively small amount of data ⚪ CoDoC could be compatible with many proprietary AI models https://t.co/zIG0B6LvvB

item.title:
🔵 How was CoDoC trained?
It needs 3 anonymised inputs for each case in the dataset:
🔘 A confidence score from the predictive AI 🔘 The clinician’s opinion on the medical image 🔘 The ground truth of whether disease was present, established via clinical follow-up https://t.co/7ec0dbdyaE
item.description:
🔵 How was CoDoC trained?
It needs 3 anonymised inputs for each case in the dataset:
🔘 A confidence score from the predictive AI 🔘 The clinician’s opinion on the medical image 🔘 The ground truth of whether disease was present, established via clinical follow-up https://t.co/7ec0dbdyaE
item.content:encoded: 🔵 How was CoDoC trained? It needs 3 anonymised inputs for each case in the dataset: 🔘 A confidence score from the predictive AI 🔘 The clinician’s opinion on the medical image 🔘 The ground truth of whether disease was present, established via clinical follow-up https://t.co/7ec0dbdyaE

item.title:
🔵 What were the results?
In hypothetical simulations where an AI could act autonomously at certain points, CoDoC reduced the number of clinician reads required by 66%.
We also showed how it can help examine chest X-rays to decide if a TB test is needed. https://t.co/gZtLxBVRSr https://t.co/FJmmKkEvLP

item.title:
🔵 What's next?
Our theoretical research explores how to harness this type of human-AI collaboration in safety-critical applications.
We are open sourcing CoDoC's code so others can build on our work improving the safety of AI models for the real world: https://t.co/Wr0tSSJGmm
